tweet: This burden will be shouldered by our children and grandchildren, and my constituents deserve better.
A two year suspension on the debt-limit will put us right back here in two years. We need to fix the broken process that got us here and make the tough decisions required to balance our budget.

I could not support yesterday's budget bill, which will add nearly $2 trillion to the federal debt over the next 10 years. At a time when we need to rein in our spending, this bill keeps us on an unsustainable path.

I invite the entire @postandcourier editorial board to come up from Charleston and join me in the Seventh District so that they can see with their own eyes why we need I-73.
You love to complain about the corridor of shame, but you don’t want to do anything to bring opportunity to this depressed region. People in my district are tired of being left behind!

Agriculture and tourism remain South Carolina’s biggest industries and the Pee Dee and Grand Strand produce an inordinately large portion of both. But we can’t grow without infrastructure and I-73 is the best investment we can make for our region and our state.

Wow. Why is the @postandcourier so hell bent against bringing opportunity to our state?? https://www.postandcourier.com/opinion/editorials/editorial-south-carolina-doesn-t-need-any-new-interstates/article_4897431a-a4d3-11e9-ad9c-5faea98e3a93.html …
